title: AkzoNobel
content:
Here’s [AkzoNobel](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172426/http:/www.akzonobel.com/)’s new logo? The old one is below...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172426im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Akzo_Nobel_3779.gif)

 [‹ Proportions of armenian typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172426/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45098 "Go to previous forum topic") [Diagraph or Stencil Machine ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172426/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45017 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Nick Job

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172426im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/AkzoNobel_6578.jpg)

Interesting. The new man seems more relaxed.

Makes me think of [Arno Breker](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706172426/http:/www.luc.edu/depts/history/dennis/Visual_Arts/17-Totalitarian-Breker-Partei-Neue-Reichskanzlei-1939.jpg) for some reason.

The type is better, but the illustration is just as stupid and will mandate a new identity in ten years.

But seriously, what joker convinced them to whack customers over the head with a video about the new logo? That’s so low class it’s pathetic. To me the whole launch has the feel of a board that overpaid for an identity and is insecure about it.

Tomorrow’s answer is nostalgia for intercaps?  
I thought that was the day after tomorrow.
Is a deleted space even intercapping, or is it something worse?
